Description: Pottery amphora with two handles from shoulder to neck, the base terminating in a moulded knob. Red-brown fabric. Fine and dense, heavy with dark red inclusions (iron rich?). Covered in white incrustation. Fine dark inclusions visble on surface. Red-brown Nile silt (?) fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Mercer Art Gallery, Harrogate. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.176)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: HARGM3813 (Accession Number possibly registered twice)
